Simulation of Systems of Particles with High Efficiency¶

The SiSyPHE library builds on recent advances in hardware and software for the efficient simulation of large scale interacting particle systems, both on the GPU and on the CPU. The implementation is based on recent libraries originally developed for machine learning purposes to significantly accelerate tensor (array) computations, namely the PyTorch package and the KeOps library. The versatile object-oriented Python interface is well suited to the comparison of new and classical many-particle models, enabling ambitious numerical experiments and leading to novel conjectures. The SiSyPHE library speeds up both traditional Python and low-level implementations by one to three orders of magnitude.

The project is hosted on GitHub, under the permissive MIT license.

Author¶

Antoine Diez, Imperial College London
